result.execSummary:
On one or more charges in this case, Kevin Scott Stadler was found not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect. The defendant was found guilty of actually committing the crime(s) charged, but was also found not to be legally responsible under Wis. Stats. 971.165 for committing the crime(s) because of the defendant's mental condition. The legal effect of a finding of not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect is that the court must commit the defendant to the custody of the Department of Health and Family Services.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

09:01 AM Attorney Jessica Fehrenbach appeared by phone.  Kurt B. Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Attorney appears by phone on behalf of the deft.  This hearing is in regards to a Cont Conditional release.  Deft is withdrawing the request at this time.  Victim rights have been complied with.  Court puts on the record that the deft can re-petition the court within 3 months instead of 6 months if wanting to bring this back to the court.

09:02 AM Defendant Kevin Scott Stadler in court, in custody with attorney Jessica Fehrenbach.  Kurt B. Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kevin Scott Stadler appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case called apeparances given.  Victim rights complied with.  Parties have not received any futher information from Dr Eagen.  This is continued Conditional Release hearing.  Court addresses the parties.  Court would like to adjourn to a date next week due to the fact we have not heard anything from the doctor.  Hearing scheduled for October 10, 2019 at 08:00 am.
from the courts to Dr Engen

10:00 AM Defendant Kevin Scott Stadler in court, in custody at Mendota with attorney Jessica Fehrenbach.  Kurt B. Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kevin Scott Stadler appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case called appearances given.  Defense motion for conditional release.  State has no witnesses and is not challenging the request of the Defense.  Court questions the State. State decision not to challenge is due to the latest report.  Court reviews the report.  Defense addresses the court. Court has concerns as to the 15 min checks for the suicide watch.  Court would like more information from the doctor as to this watch.  Court needs more information to makes his findings.  Arguments by the parties as to the release.  Court makes a call to Mendota at 1-608-301-1116.  Court talks with Social Worker that is on the video with the deft.  Court questions the Social Worker as to the status of the deft.  Social worker checks the status and watch level has been lowered Papa Fall is the name of the Social worker.  Social workers is asked questions by the parties.  Court takes a recess to research a few things at 10:38 am.  Back on the record at 10:58 am.  Court addresses the parties as to what he has found.  Court decides to get more information on the status of the deft at Mendota.  Court will get it back on the calendar within 30 days.  Defense addresses the court as to his decision.  Hearing scheduled for October 1, 2019 at 09:00 am.
from C. Engen to the Court - request extension to complete report

11:00 AM Defendant Kevin Scott Stadler in court, in custody with attorney Jessica Fehrenbach.  Kurt B. Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kevin Scott Stadler appeared by video means from Mendota West with Attorney.  Case called appearances given.  Conditional Release Hearing Defense is not contesting the recommendations of the Doctor.  Defense attorney addresses the court.  Doctors recommendation is to not grant the conditional release.  Defense accepts the report and has no questions of the doctor.  Victim rights have been complied with.  Court addresses the parties.  Court does not grant the conditional release at this time.  Deft remains subject to the commentment order.    Defense has not objection of releasing the report to the Social Worker.

Defense informs the court that the deft does not want to proceed with a conditional release at this time. Court accepts.  Court addresses the defense that this is the second time the deft has withdrawn his petition.  If the deft requests again we are going to proceed with the hearing.

Defendant Kevin Scott Stadler in court, in custody.  Sally Fleischman from LSS.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  Sally Fleischman  duly sworn and testifies.  Id'd deft in the courtroom.  Crossed by the deft.  Court reads order.  Arguements heard.  Court addresses the deft.  Court rules that a condition of release was violated.  Order for placement has been completed and signed.  Court determined that conditional release would cause harm to the community and the deft.  Court signs order for deft to take medications.  Pleacement is instutional care and the Sheriff's dept will transport.  All LSS records to be sealed.

Defendant Kevin Scott Stadler in court, in custody with attorney David Gardner Casey.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michelle Brandt from LSS. State calls the case Appearances given.  Order is presented to the parties  for their review.   State and defense have no questions of Ms Brandt.  Defense attorney addressed any questions before the hearing.  Court addresses Ms Brandt and questions the appointments.  All appointments have been set.   Plan should be active upon release from jail on 8/28/15  Discussion of medications being taken.  Court does approve the plan.  Court makes the necessary additions and signs the order.  Parties agree to have the plan attached to the order and sealed.

Defendant Kevin Scott Stadler in court, in custody with attorney David Gardner Casey.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No conditional release plan has been received by either party.  Defense addresses the court.  Deft has not been contacted.   State updates the court as to the outcome of the prior hearing.  Defense adds to update of the prior hearing.  Sally Fleischman (Lutheran Social Services) by phone.  Court questions as to the status of the plan.  No order was received by LSS.    Order to be faxed to LSS today.  LSS will go on Monday to talk with the deft.  Clerk to fax to LSS today along with the complaint and Dr's report from the file.  

Not to own or possess any firearms.  Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
of Commitment (not guilty by reason of Mental Disease or Defect) - signed by the court

Defendant Kevin Scott Stadler in court, in custody with attorney David Gardner Casey.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dr Galli is appearing by phone.  State addresses the court and let it know where we are at, the defense agrees.  Court makes a finding that the deft meets the criteria for a NGI plea.   A judgment of NGI is entered against the deft.  Need to resolve if he should be committed by inpatient or outpatient.   Dr Galli gives his findings to the court.  And feels he could be treated as an out patient or conditional release basis. The State has not questions at this time.  The length of the committment could be as long as the jail sentence.  Court agrees with the doctor.  Court signs order for a conditional release of the deft to the dept of Health Services in the State of Wisconsin, take medicines as the court has ordered.  Deft has agreed to follow all necessary conditions.  Defense will prepare the order for the court to sign.   Deft is not to be released till the order is signed and the dept of State/County Health Services has meet with the deft.  And a plan is in place for the deft.  The plan will presented to the court for approval with 21 days.  Defense will have the order to the court today for review and approval.  
Court orders a committment of 5 years also needs to stay crime free for 5 years.

Defendant Kevin Scott Stadler in court, in custody with attorney David Gardner Casey.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No victim rights issues able to start early.

Defense has provided a report from Dr Galli.  Dr says the deft is not guilty by mental disease.  Court is to order comittment  Defense addresses the court. Defense will submit a copy of the Dr's report to the court to review.  After the court is finished the report is to be sealed.  Jury Trial can be removed from the courts calendar.  Hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court accepts the NGI plea.

Defense will contact Dr Galli to see if he can appear by phone.  Defense will prepare the necessary orders.
